description:
simple and straightforward, works flawlessly:
- MAC address can be entered any way it's commonly listed; dashes, colons or neither
- allows local or internet packets to be sent on any port
- it can display machines in ARP cache (LAN only, obviously)

could use the following improvements:
- ability to add & customize shortcuts, which may require the program to run as a service but being able to press, say, ctrl + f12 to wake the machine i want would be very useful (i know this is possible from within ubuntu already, just a suggestion)
- the green check next to a machine when clicking turn on could use some explanation, does it mean the machine is on? or only that the packet was sent? what should happen when sending the packet a second time?
- ability to group machines together by category (work, home, school, church and etc.) and send packets to the entire group
- similar to the last point, waking many machines through ssh -t might be of use, though that would probably be outside the scope of this app, but might be a useful integration
- icons (custom? or unicode would work) to be added to each machine type to more easily differentiate machine types or functions
Läuft ohne Probleme auf meinem Ubuntu 23.10. Absolut simlpe Einrichtung, MAC eingeben und fertig.
summary: Läuft ohne Probleme auf meinem Ubuntu 23.10
